alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 3:58AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT SOUTHERN WASHBURN...EAST CENTRAL BURNETT AND SOUTHERN SAWYER COUNTIES... At 355 AM CST, heavy snow showers were along a line extending from 18 miles southeast of Chippewa Flowage East, to near Winter, to Radisson, to 6 miles southwest of Couderay, to near Birchwood, to near Spooner, to 7 miles northeast of Hertel, and moving southeast at 35 mph. Visibilities of 1/2 mile or less, wind gusts up to 35 mph, and rapid snow accumulation on roads are expected with these heavy snow showers. These heavy snow showers will be near... Spooner, Shell Lake, Birchwood, and Exeland around 400 AM CST. Highways affected include... Wisconsin Highway 27 between Stone Lake and the Rusk County line. Wisconsin Highway 70 between Hertel and Loretta. US Highway 53 between Trego and the Barron County line. US Highway 63 between Springbrook and the Barron County line. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down, allow extra following and stopping distance between you and the vehicle in front of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination.
